TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant was a judge and the President of ORG ( PERSON ) . He was also a member of ORG ( PERSON sudbeno vijeće , hereinafter the “ ORG ” ) . Sometime in DATE the ORG filed a request with the ORG to open disciplinary proceedings against the applicant . They alleged that from DATE the applicant had conducted sexual relationships with minors and that from DATE onwards he had used his position to protect the financial activities of CARDINAL individuals who were known for their criminal activities , and had thus caused damage to the reputation of the judiciary , which amounted to a serious disciplinary offence . For these reasons they proposed that disciplinary proceedings be instituted against the applicant and that a disciplinary sanction be imposed , including that he be permanently removed from office as a judge and as President of ORG . Furthermore , they asked for the applicant ’s immediate provisional removal from office during the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG instituted disciplinary proceedings against the applicant . On DATE the applicant filed a motion seeking the withdrawal from the case of CARDINAL members of the ORG , namely GPE , PERSON and PERSON , on the ground that they had shown their bias towards the applicant in interviews published in various national newspapers . The motion was denied on DATE as being unfounded . At the hearing held on DATE the ORG refused the applicant ’s request that the hearings before it be public on the ground that the exclusion of the public was necessary for the protection of the interests of the applicant and the judiciary as such without any further reasoning . Further hearings were held on DATE and DATE . On DATE the ORG found that the applicant had committed a disciplinary offence in maintaining contacts and appearing in public with ORG and PERSON despite knowing that they had been convicted of numerous crimes , and of using his position to protect these CARDINAL ORG interests and gains from DATE . The ORG further found the remaining allegations against the applicant unfounded and thus requiring no disciplinary measures . It was decided to remove the applicant from his post as judge and President of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE an interview with V.M. , a member of the ORG , was published in the national DATE newspaper “ GPE list ” . It was entitled “ GPE was a partisan candidate , not me ” , and the relevant parts of the interview read as follows :

“ In the case at issue the ORG established that for DATE of time PERSON had had frequent public social contacts with QUANTITY persons who not only had been convicted of numerous criminal offences , but against whom criminal proceedings are currently pending - in CARDINAL case for assault on a policeman , and in the other for the trade of QUANTITY of heroin - and that he had even intervened on their behalf . CARDINAL . On DATE an interview with ORG , the then president of ORG , entitled “ Judges are appointed , but also created ” was published in the same DATE newspaper . The relevant parts of the interview read :
Question : “ -The National Judicial Council has lately been mentioned in public mostly in connection with the ‘ Olujić case’ . What is the truth about the former ORG President ?

Answer : - The decision has been taken and reasons have been given in it . I do n’t think that I have to explain a reasoned decision , everything was said in it . For me these proceedings are in the past .
Q : - However , for the sake of the public , which has received conflicting information about this case , could you be more specific ?

A : - Since you insist , I shall just say that Dr PERSON has committed a disciplinary offence not only by “ socialising ” with perpetrators of numerous criminal offences , although this in itself is a serious matter for any president of ORG , but primarily because , while President of ORG , and aware of these NORP criminal activity , that is , that they belonged to the international criminal milieu , he used his personal influence and contacts in order to protect their interests and gains . Analysis of the evidence and defence [ pleadings ] clearly showed that the ORG ’s request to institute proceedings had in no way been politically motivated or a fabricated indictment put forward by the political and partisan elite , as Dr PERSON stated in his defence and alleged before the media , referring to the President of GPE . On the contrary , the case is about indecent activities which are incompatible not only with the office of ORG President , which Dr PERSON held for a short period , but with judicial ethics in general .
Q : - And what about the interception of telephone calls ?

A : - The interception of telephone conversations concerned legally recorded telephone conversations between the above - mentioned perpetrators of numerous criminal offences , but not at all Dr GPE ’s telephone conversations . [ Olujić ] “ was netted ” by this operative measure , as CARDINAL of the witnesses expressed it illustratively . The [ National Judicial ] Council assessed that evidence , together with all the other evidence , in line with the principle of free assessment of evidence , and it did not significantly influence its decision . ”
